context: In <a0_0>September <b11_0>2014<b11_0/><a0_0/>, <a5_0><b10_0>Professor Stefan Grimm<b10_0/><a5_0/>, of the <a6_0>Department of Medicine<a6_0/>, was found dead after being threatened with <a7_0>dismissal<a7_0/> for failure to raise enough grant money. The College made its first public announcement of his death on <a1_0>4 December 2014<a1_0/>. Grimm's last email accused <b14_0>his employers<b14_0/> of <a3_0><b13_0>bullying<b13_0/><a3_0/> by demanding that he should get grants worth at least <a8_0>£200,000<a8_0/> per year. His last email was viewed <a2_0><a9_0>more than 100,000<a9_0/><a2_0/> times in the first four days after it was posted. The College has announced an <a4_0>internal inquiry<a4_0/> into <b12_0>Stefan Grimm's death<b12_0/>. The inquest on his death has not yet reported.
